result.execSummary:
All charges against Nicholas Dion Johannsen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Dion Johannsen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Dion Johannsen

11:37 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Nicholas Dion Johannsen. Defendant Nicholas Dion Johannsen in court. INCLUDES 22CM163, 22CM287, 22CM371 and 22CM416,  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Cts 1 and 2 - Misd Bail Jumping in 22CM287 and Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct with Domestic Abuse Modifier in 22CM416. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1 and 2 - Misd Bail Jumping in 22CM287 and Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct with Domestic Abuse Modifier in 22CM416. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 1, 3-8 in 22CM416 and cases 22CM163 and 22CM371 in their entirety. Sentencing recommendations.

Defendant to test clean before release.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Defendant to attend the motivation group on 6/23/22 at 2:30 PM. Justice Support Services at 715-245-4109.
